$interpreted: Dagger: ...You were saying... void disease?
Kittyeyes: Those infected barely live on to tell the tale.
Kittyeyes: Few resist becoming monsters themselves. Even if they do, infection takes the form of void disease.
Nolva: This disease will affect its host based on Atlas' void seasons.
Dagger: Tsk, what a hassle. Humans have no cure?!
Dagger: ...Was I that frightening...?
Nolva: The symptoms vary between people.
Nolva: So we've yet to discover a universal treatment...
Dagger: Now I get it, so Roger's unstable emotional state and purple arm were caused by the void disease...
Dagger: What other symptoms are there?
Kittyeyes: ……….
Dagger: Cat got your tongue? Or is there really more to it?
Nolva: Actually um...Dagger, I also have void disease!
Dagger: You too?! But, you don't seem to have suffered from a vicious monster assault, have you?
Nolva: Mother was pregnant when Atlas met its demise. She inhaled monster Soul Energy, then gave birth.
Nolva: That's how I was infected.
Dagger: That counts too?
Nolva: Once a being's Soul Energy is tainted by monsters, one could be said to have void disease.
Dagger: Do you throw temper tantrums too?
Nolva: No I don't, my symptoms are...
Nolva: ...are...
Dagger: What's this about?!
Kittyeyes: That's her symptom. She loses consciousness unexpectedly.
Dagger: What? How long is she going to sleep?
Kittyeyes: Depends. Can vary from a day or so up to half a year.
Bandit Bigwig: Aha~ Finally! Someone wandered onto our turf!
Bandit: Got any valuables to share? GIMME!
Dagger: Damn it, there are so many of them...We have two that are in coma, this is going to be hard.

Bandit: Give me all your money, otherwise I'm going to
start fumbling with this gal's possessions!
Dagger: What the hell was that?
Kittyeyes: I'll explain later. Let's get rid of them first.
Dagger: So Nolva's now...
Kittyeyes: There's a monster that lives within Nolva.
Kittyeyes: Whenever Nolva falls into slumber, the monster takes over her body.
Dagger: MONSTER?! So she's...
Kittyeyes: Not to worry. She came to terms with her inner demon long before I met her. It's harmless.
Kittyeyes: Sis Nolva is coming with us to Aosta's. Let's go.
Nolva: ……….
Kittyeyes: Alright, shuffle those feet.
Dagger: ...I think to myself, what a wonderful world.

Model.Text: ...You were saying... void disease?
Those infected barely live on to tell the tale.
Few resist becoming monsters themselves. Even if they do, infection takes the form of void disease.
This disease will affect its host based on Atlas' void seasons.
Tsk, what a hassle. Humans have no cure?!
...Was I that frightening...?
The symptoms vary between people.
So we've yet to discover a universal treatment...
Now I get it, so Roger's unstable emotional state and purple arm were caused by the void disease...
What other symptoms are there?
Cat got your tongue? Or is there really more to it?
Actually um...Dagger, I also have void disease!
You too?! But, you don't seem to have suffered from a vicious monster assault, have you?
Mother was pregnant when Atlas met its demise. She inhaled monster Soul Energy, then gave birth.
That's how I was infected.
That counts too?
Once a being's Soul Energy is tainted by monsters, one could be said to have void disease.
Do you throw temper tantrums too?
No I don't, my symptoms are...
What's this about?!
That's her symptom. She loses consciousness unexpectedly.
What? How long is she going to sleep?
Depends. Can vary from a day or so up to half a year.
Aha~ Finally! Someone wandered onto our turf!
Got any valuables to share? GIMME!
Damn it, there are so many of them...We have two that are in coma, this is going to be hard.

Give me all your money, otherwise I'm going to
start fumbling with this gal's possessions!
What the hell was that?
I'll explain later. Let's get rid of them first.
So Nolva's now...
There's a monster that lives within Nolva.
Whenever Nolva falls into slumber, the monster takes over her body.
MONSTER?! So she's...
Not to worry. She came to terms with her inner demon long before I met her. It's harmless.
Sis Nolva is coming with us to Aosta's. Let's go.
Alright, shuffle those feet.
...I think to myself, what a wonderful world.
